result.execSummary:
The defendant Amir A. Ali was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amir A. Ali is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amir A. Ali was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Amir A. Ali was found guilty of Attempt Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 41 days served, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA  sample (unless previously provided)
** Pay DNA surcharges   Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action. May Not have contact with Christina Bess unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber allowed.   Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.addlTxt: For Cts 3 & 4 only - Dismissed.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State in victim compliance.  On State's motion, cts 3 & 4 are dismissed.  Deft pleads no contest to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions, concurrent on cts 1 & 2; 30 days conditional jail w/Huber privileges; credit for 41 days served if revoked; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $400 DNA surcharge, bond applied to costs.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA E Trigg.
Jury status hearing at 12-17-2015 01:00 pm

Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:50 am.
